Report an issue

Create Charts for Dashboard

About

Overview

This step will create charts to be displayed as part of the dashboard to summarize the audience group(s).

Order of Operations

This step can be run prospectively at the end of the inference period, just before the start of the campaign, when all the inference data (first-time visitors to the store) becomes available.

User Inputs

Define the following

  1. BigQuery
    • dataset id
    • table ids for audience
      • cohorts
      • profile
# 1. GCP resources
gbq_dataset_id = 'mydemo2asdf'
gbq_table_id_cohorts = 'audience_cohorts'
gbq_table_id_profiles = 'audience_profiles'

Create a mapping between action type integer and label, in order to get meaningful names from the audience_strategy column in the profiles data

audience_strategy_mapper = {1: "Multi-Group", 2: "Single Group"}

Get Data

Profiles

query = f"""
        SELECT *
        FROM {gbq_table_fully_resolved_profiles}
        """
df_profiles = (
    th.extract_data(query, gcp_auth_dict)
    .pipe(th.map_columns, {'audience_strategy': audience_strategy_mapper})
    .pipe(th.set_datatypes, dtypes_dict_profiles)
)
df_profiles

Cohorts

query = f"""
        SELECT *
        FROM {gbq_table_fully_resolved_cohorts}
        """
df_cohorts = (
    th.extract_data(query, gcp_auth_dict)
    .pipe(th.map_columns, {'audience_strategy': audience_strategy_mapper})
    .pipe(th.set_datatypes, dtypes_dict_cohort)
)
